Initially working for the American company Paramount, they formed the company Paris-Film Production in 1934, and financed Julien Duvivier's \"\"Pépé le Moko\"\" in 1936, Jean Renoir's \"\"La Bête Humaine\"\" (1938) and Marcel Carné's \"\"Le Jour se lève\"\" (\"\"Daybreak\"\" 1939), all starring Jean Gabin, before the brothers emigrated to the United States.", "score": 0.79541015625}, {"long_text": "\"René Clair\"\nRené Clair René Clair (11 November 1898 – 15 March 1981) born René-Lucien Chomette, was a French filmmaker and writer. He went on to make some of the most innovative early sound films in France, before going abroad to work in the UK and USA for more than a decade. {"search_query": "birth year of directors of A Yank In Korea and The Tunnel (1933 French-Language Film)", "passages_this_hop": [{"long_text": "\"Robert Florey\"\nRobert Florey Robert Florey (14 September 1900 – 16 May 1979) was a French-American director, screenwriter, film journalist and actor. Born as Robert Fuchs in Paris, he became an orphan at an early age and was then raised in Switzerland.
